intro: Amsinckiopsis kingii var. kingii, commonly known as the King's amsinckia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable component of its native ecosystem.
